pullRequest.body:
We prove that the directed union of a non-empty directed union of ideals of subsets of a preorder is an ideal, and in particular ideals of subsets of a preorder are stable under unions. In order to prove it, we also add `directed_on_sUnion`, a variant of `directed_on_iUnion`. 

---

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

I also did "Resolve conversation" for each comment and changed back to "awaiting-review". I hope this is the correct workflow?
I just added the deprecation notice as per @Ruben-VandeVelde 's suggestion.

This should be `directedOn__sUnion`. The one above is wrong too - if it's not used too much, you might rename it in this PR, leaving a deprecated alias. Alternatively leave a TODO comment
Done (and moved to line 2037), see comment below.
Can this proof reuse the theorem above?

I would suggest doing the rename suggested above, and moving both lemmas to below `sUnion_eq_iUnion` and proving the latter as

```lean
theorem directedOn_sUnion {r} {S : Set (Set Î±)} (hd : DirectedOn (Â· âŠ† Â·) S)
    (h : âˆ€ x âˆˆ S, DirectedOn r x) : DirectedOn r (â‹ƒâ‚€ S) := by
  rw [sUnion_eq_iUnion]
  exact directed_on_iUnion (directedOn_iff_directed.mp hd) (fun i â†¦ h i.1 i.2)
```
Thanks! I did what Dagur suggested.
I think`isIdeal_sUnion_of_directedOn`
You use `hNe` before and `hne` here. It would be better to be consistent
`_of_isChain`

We want to give any downstream users of this theorem a pointer where it went, like this:

```suggestion
#align set.directed_on_Union Set.directedOn_iUnion

@[deprecated (since = "2024-05-05")]
alias directed_on_iUnion := directedOn_iUnion
```
(Writing on mobile, so I hope I got that right)

